TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 858-859
TEI.2.document_title: Aylett C. Buckner to Stephen F. Austin, 07-25-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 858-859

div1.p: Aylett C. Buckner to Austin, July 25, 1824. Land.

Sir Mr. Bell has in his possession my note for five mules which are for your benefit—I pd you $40. which discharged two of them Robert Kuykendall told me he paid you one more and as it is high time I had lifted the note which I am anxious to do I send you the order on him for the enclosed act. which I must trouble you to present. I am too unwell to wride over and whatever may be lacking I will settle with you in a short time.
